text: Aäläm-Wärqe Davidian, commonly credited as Alamork Davidian in English, is an Ethiopian-Israeli film director."Alamork Marsha heads to Ethiopia for 'Fig Tree' shoot". Screen Daily, July 10, 2016. Her directorial debut, Fig Tree, was an Ophir Award nominee for Best Picture in 2018."Gay-themed films battle for the Ophir Prize". The Jerusalem Post, September 5, 2018. Fig Tree was based in part on her own childhood in Addis Ababa prior to emigrating to Israel."8 Features That Center On Black Lives at the 2018 Toronto International Film Festival". IndieWire, September 5, 2018. She is married to film director and producer Kobi Davidian. At the 2018 Toronto International Film Festival, she won the Eurimages Audentia Award for Best Female Director for Fig Tree."‘Green Book’ Takes Toronto Film Festival’s 2018 People’s Choice Award". Variety, September 16, 2018. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Ethiopian film directors Category:Israeli film directors Category:Ethiopian emigrants to Israel Category:People from Addis Ababa Category:Living people Category:Israeli women film directors Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Alamork Davidian
